subject: Re: [junit] NEW Object instance
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I meant assertion . The above test is the same as this: public void testCreation () { MyClass obj = new MyClass(param1, param2); } -- J. B. (Joe)
messageBody:
teemu kanstren wrote:
> 2006/5/10, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...>:
> >
> > >
> > > Let's assume you have class MyClass with a constructor that accepts 2
> > > parameters. As far as I know, the easiest way to test object creation
> > > is:
> > >
> > > public void testCreation () {
> > > MyClass obj = new MyClass(param1, param2);
> > > assertNotNull(obj);
> > > }
> >
> > This test can never fail, so why write it?
> >
>
> I think it could fail if the constructor threw an exception :). I don't see
> how the assertion would fail though. Nor do I think it would be a good test
> but I guess that depends on what you write in the constructors of you
> classes I guess.

Yes, I meant "assertion". The above test is the same as this:

public void testCreation () {
MyClass obj = new MyClass(param1, param2);
}
